metadata.title: CVE-2017-5078 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient validation of untrusted input in Blink's mailto: handling inGoogle Chrome prior to 59.0.3071.86 for Linux, Windows, and Mac allowed aremote attacker to perform command injection via a crafted HTML page, asimilar issue to CVE-2004-0121. For example, characters such as * have anincorrect interaction with xdg-email in xdg-utils, and a space charactercan be used in front of a command-line argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
